ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: Provides functions related to human natural ordering. It handles adjacent digits in a character sequence as a number so that natural sort function arranges a character vector by their numbers, not digit characters. It is typically seen when operating systems lists file names. For example, a sequence a-1.png, a-2.png, a-10.png looks naturally ordered because 1 < 2 < 10 and natural sort algorithm arranges so whereas general sort algorithms arrange it into a-1.png, a-10.png, a-2.png owing to their third and fourth characters.

Provides functions related to human natural ordering. It handles adjacent digits in a character sequence as a number so that natural sort function arranges a character vector by their numbers, not digit characters. It is typically seen when operating systems lists file names. For example, a sequence a-1.png, a-2.png, a-10.png looks naturally ordered because 1 < 2 < 10 and natural sort algorithm arranges so whereas general sort algorithms arrange it into a-1.png, a-10.png, a-2.png owing to their third and fourth characters.

name: r-naturalsort
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "0.1.3" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-naturalsort
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/naturalsort_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/naturalsort/naturalsort_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: cd38a9c5f323f61459e6096cdbf4493851d40497baf671af4f8dfe9a7c00e857

build:
  number: 1007
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:

  host:
    - r-base
  run:
    - r-base

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('naturalsort')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('naturalsort')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=naturalsort
  license: BSD-3-Clause
  summary: Provides functions related to human natural ordering. It handles adjacent digits in a character sequence as a number so that natural sort function arranges a character vector by their numbers, not digit characters. It is typically seen when operating systems lists file names. For example, a sequence a-1.png, a-2.png,
    a-10.png looks naturally ordered because 1 < 2 < 10 and natural sort algorithm arranges so whereas general sort algorithms arrange it into a-1.png, a-10.png, a-2.png owing to their third and fourth characters.
  license_family: BSD
  license_file:
    - {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/BSD_3_clause
    - LICENSE

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r

# Package: naturalsort
# Type: Package
# Title: Natural Ordering
# Version: 0.1.3
# Suggests: testthat
# Date: 2016-08-30
# Author: Kosei Abe
# Maintainer: Kosei Abe <mail@recyclebin.jp>
# Description: Provides functions related to human natural ordering. It handles adjacent digits in a character sequence as a number so that natural sort function arranges a character vector by their numbers, not digit characters. It is typically seen when operating systems lists file names. For example, a sequence a-1.png, a-2.png, a-10.png looks naturally ordered because 1 < 2 < 10 and natural sort algorithm arranges so whereas general sort algorithms arrange it into a-1.png, a-10.png, a-2.png owing to their third and fourth characters.
# License: BSD_3_clause + file LICENSE
# BugReports: https://github.com/kos59125/naturalsort/issues
